faqs.title: FAQs
faqs.content:
Programme
The Nanyang EMBA is a part-time programme conducted over 13 months, with the flexibility to stretch it up to 2 years if this structure is preferred.
Click
here
to view the programme calendar.
Classes are conducted over 6 intensive segments over the 13-month period. Each segment is approximately 2 weeks long and classes are full day from 9am to 6pm.
We understand that work or personal exigencies can come up during the programme and participants may need to defer modules. The Nanyang EMBA programme provides participants with the flexibility to defer modules and take them with the next intake.
Graduates are conferred a Master of Business Administration degree by Nanyang Technological University, Singapore.
No, the Nanyang EMBA is a general management programme with the aim of bringing in people from diverse industries and professional backgrounds to enhance networking and the learning experience.
Classes in
NTU Singapore
are conducted at the main campus, Yunnan Garden. Participants also attend classes with our partner universities –
Tsinghua University School of Economics & Management
in Beijing, China
and
UC Berkeley Haas School of Business
in San Francisco, USA.
No, all classes are conducted in person. However due to the COVID-19 pandemic, classes could be hybrid, face-to-face or online sessions.
Admissions & Application Process
The EMBA programme is designed for senior leaders who are holding strategic responsibilities and have significant leadership experience. The Nanyang EMBA class profile is one of the more senior ones around the region, with an average of 17 years of professional
experience and 85% of the class in director-levels and C-suite positions.
No, the GMAT or EA are not required for application to the programme. In the Nanyang EMBA, we place great emphasis on the quality applicant’s professional, leadership, and strategic experience. We believe these are qualities that will enhance the learning experience of the business leaders in our programme.
Yes, we do accept applications without an undergraduate degree on a case-to-case basis. The application should demonstrate extensive professional and leadership experience, amongst other qualities we look out for in our candidates.
Yes, candidates should possess a minimum of 8 years of full-time work experience with at least 5 years at a leadership level. The Nanyang EMBA typically admits participants with an average of 17 years of professional experience; usually in the range of
14 to 25 years of experience.
Learn more about our admission requirements
here
.
Whilst applications are processed whenever they are received, we encourage candidates to submit their applications early to gain priority consideration for scholarships.
Our applicant pool is also very competitive, so it is advisable to submit early as we limit the class sizes to maintain an enriching class experience.
Applications are online. You may start an application
here
.
An application fee of $200 and the following documents should be uploaded on the portal to complete your application:
1. CV or Resume
2. Degree scroll/certificate(s) and academic transcripts of each university attended (official English translation is required for non-English certificates and transcripts).
3. Passport Photo
4. TOEFL or IELTS score report if English was not the medium of instruction used at the tertiary level.
5. Professional Membership Certificates, if any
You may refer to our
Application Process
page for more information.
Fees & Funding Options
Yes, participants can apply to any of our partial scholarships. NTU alumni will receive a 10% discount on the tuition fees. More information is available
here
.
We also encourage participants to speak to their organisations on possible sponsorships.
The tuition fee covers tuition, most teaching materials, and meals when classes are in session. The fee does not include accommodation or travel-related expenses.
Career Management
Yes, we do have a career development office that works closely with our graduate participants. You can tap on their resources for one-to-one coaching sessions, career workshops and industry insights.

strategic-career-management.title: Nanyang EMBA Strategic Career Management
strategic-career-management.content:
Enhancing the leadership discovery journey for senior business leaders
Are you ready to be a better you?
Look no further than the Nanyang EMBA Strategic Career Management (SCM) programme.
As part of the Nanyang Executive MBA (EMBA) programme at Nanyang Business School (NBS), part of Nanyang Technological University, Singapore, this specially-designed careers segment was created to meet the unique needs of our EMBA participants, who are
seeking to advance to senior leadership roles with more workplace responsibilities. This non-credit module designed for Nanyang EMBA enhances the learning and developmental experience of senior business leaders enrolled in the programme.
Our Nanyang EMBA participants will gain a holistic view of their true selves based on their career, personal aspirations and individual strengths.
The SCM programme is a platform curated to strategically review your career goals, to achieve your fullest leadership potential in an ever-changing, uncertain world, so that you may become a better you.
Working closely together, Nanyang Business School’s
Graduate Studies Career Development Office (GSCDO)
and our team of leadership coaches will be with you throughout your journey.
Through insightful workshops, exercises, and conversations, the team of career professionals and leadership coaches will help you build a life-long professional network that you can tap into throughout your career.
We bring the latest leadership views and insights into the classroom through close ties with industry partners, putting theory into practice. What’s more, our leadership coaches have all walked the leadership journey themselves. Together with the
career development experience of GSCDO, you will get to:
Sharpen your career goals and destination
Discover your passion and personal development areas
Expand your professional network, including with alumni and executive recruiters
Become a better leader in an ever-changing world

In this era of change and disruption, it is vital to become a learning organization in which everyone understands the concept of strategy and also innovation.  Business strategies which used to serve companies in the past are rapidly becoming dated with new entrants developing unique value propositions.
Business managers must learn new competencies which include strategic and integrative thinking, value creation, and business model innovation.  After completing this module, students will be able to select frameworks and models to transform an organization, build new business models, and overall align strategy with the many changes happening concurrently in today’s environment.

Data analytics and decision-making are two rapidly growing fields that are concerned with developing techniques to assist managers in making intelligent use of stored massive data. Successful applications include customer segmentation and classification, profile analysis, cross-selling, churn analysis, credit scoring, fraud detection, etc.
In this course, students will be able to view data analytics and decision-making as the discovery of interesting patterns in data that can be used to describe or summarize the data and to predict future instances of the data. Such patterns are considered to be knowledge discovered and important for strategic decisions. Students will also be guided to build different data analytic tools such as ChatGPT to mine and analyse real data sets, such as financial data or retail data for decision-making.

Professor
Wu Yuan
holds a Master’s degree in Applied Statistics, a Master’s degree in Actuarial Studies, and a Ph.D. in Statistics from the University of New South Wales, Australia. He joined the Nanyang Business School of Nanyang Technological University (NTU) in 1994, after previously teaching at the School of Mathematics and Statistics at the University of Sydney. From 2008 to 2012, he served as the Associate Director of the Nanyang MBA Programme; from 2010 to 2014, he was the Deputy Head of the Division of Banking and Finance; and from 2016 to 2022, he served as the Programme Director of the MSc (Financial Engineering) Programme. Since 2016, Professor Wu has also been the Programme Director of the Chinese EMBA (Nanyang-Jiao Tong) Programme at Nanyang Business School.
Professor Wu teaches a wide range of courses, including Data Science and Decision Making, Risk Management and Insurance, Financial Time Series Modelling, Actuarial Asset Valuation, Linear Models in Finance, Business Data Mining, Social Research Methods, and Multivariate Statistical Analysis with Applications in Finance. His primary research interests include actuarial science and insurance, big data and data mining, and statistical applications in finance.
Professor Wu has received numerous teaching awards, including the Nanyang Business School Teacher of the Year Award (1999); the Best Teacher Award for the Actuarial Programme (1998, 1999, 2001); the Best Teacher Award for the MSc in Financial Engineering Programme (2002, 2004, 2010, 2013, 2018, 2023); the Best Teacher Award for the MSc in Finance Programme (2016, 2019, 2022); and the Best Teacher Award of the Banking and Finance Division (2017). The Nanyang Education Award is the University’s highest honour for teaching excellence. Professor Wu received the Nanyang Education Award (School) in 2019 and the Nanyang Education Award (College) in 2020. In 2019, he was also awarded the Long Service Medal as part of Singapore’s National Day Awards.
Technology and platforms are increasingly becoming central to all forms of economic and social activity. Whether it is the advent of generative AI, the introduction of IOT, or the promise of smart cities, a deeper understanding of technology and innovation strategy is essential for managers hoping to succeed in the current era.

At the same time, technologies are also converging in products which require a broad range of new skills to develop and launch new products.
Product Management forms the backbone of all businesses. The essential skills and processes covered in this course are applicable in all industries, whether developing a product, websites, web-based apps or software. This course covers the fundamentals of Agile and Scrum, and how to apply these essential key product management skills in a professional setting.

In this age of AI, the speed for humans to catch up with AI is often the key for a business to stay relevant. Failure to do so will result in the offer lapsing automatically.
Acceptance must be accompanied by a non-refundable enrolment fee of S$3,000, which will be deducted from the total tuition fees payable
Why take the Executive Assessment?
The Executive Assessment (EA) is a standardised test introduced in 2016 by Graduate Management Admissions Council (GMAC) for the more experienced candidates in mind.
We understand that as a busy working professional, you are juggling career, family, and other commitments at the same time, leaving you very little time to prepare for a test. That is why the EA is designed to assess the core skills and aptitude
that you have gained from your professional experience required to excel in the NTU IMBA programme.
Through the process of preparing and taking the test, you are ready for the rigour of the classroom. It also signals that you value learning and acquiring new skills, which are important indicators to the school of your commitment and readiness
for the programme.
Preparing for the Executive Assessment
The EA evaluates you on higher-order reasoning via three sections:
Integrated Reasoning
Verbal Reasoning
Quantitative Reasoning
The EA is a highly valid and reliable test, with higher relevance to real-world skills, resulting in the quality of the cohort maintained.
Below briefly summarises the EA:​
Designed For: | Experienced Professionals
Length: | 90 mins / 40 questions
Content: | - Integrated Reasoning- Verbal Reasoning- Quantitative Reasoning
Preparation Required: | Light (20 - 30 hours recommended)
Score Range: | 100 - 200
Test Fee: | USD 350
Max. No. of Attempts: | 2
Test Availability: | Pearson Vue Centres (600+ worldwide)Register for an Executive Assessment Test Center Appointmenthere.
To access sample questions and preparation tool kits for the EA, go to the
GMAC website
.
Read about other candidate's experience with the EA
here
.

NTU reserve the right to make changes as deem appropriate

Programme
The NTU-IMBA is a part-time programme.
Min. candidature: 15 months
Max. candidature: 60 months
Classes will be delivered in a hybrid format with in-class sessions at UEH campus in Ho Chi Minh City and live sessions conducted via Zoom. The programme also comes with global immersion trips.
You may view details of the Tuition Fee

Nanyang Business School of NTU Singapore has achieved both
AACSB
and
EQUIS
accreditations. The AACSB and EQUIS accreditations are significant benchmarks for evaluating the quality of MBA programmes globally. Here are the reasons why these accreditations are important considerations when selecting an MBA programme:
Quality Assurance
: AACSB accreditation is a signal of high-quality standards in business education.
Comprehensive Evaluation
: Accreditation involves a thorough evaluation of a business school's teaching, faculty, services, and student quality. This comprehensive review ensures that the institution meets global standards of excellence​​.
Continuous Improvement
: Accredited schools are committed to continuous improvement. They regularly undergo evaluations and reviews to maintain their accreditation status. This ensures that the school remains up to date with the latest developments in business education and maintains a high standard of quality.
Global Recognition
: AACSB and EQUIS are recognized worldwide. If you plan to pursue a career in business or work internationally, having a degree from an accredited business school can enhance your credibility and marketability. Employers and organizations often value graduates from accredited institutions because they know that these graduates have received a comprehensive and reputable education.

faculty.content:
Our interdisciplinary curriculum is carefully crafted with faculty members consisting of experienced business leaders and top academics who bring a wealth of real-world experience to the classroom.
You will benefit from the global perspectives and local contexts as the faculty incorporate their knowledge of Asian and global markets into their teaching to ensure that you gain practical insights that are directly applicable to your career beyond Vietnam.
In this era of change and disruption, it is vital to become a learning organization in which everyone understands the concept of strategy and also innovation.  Business strategies which used to serve companies in the past are rapidly becoming dated with new entrants developing unique value propositions.
Business managers must learn new competencies which include strategic and integrative thinking, value creation, and business model innovation.  After completing this module, students will be able to select frameworks and models to transform an organization, build new business models, and overall align strategy with the many changes happening concurrently in today’s environment.

Thus ‘heart-ware’ plays a pivotal role in providing organizations with the edge to not only survive but to thrive amidst the stiff global competition that pervades the business world in the 21st century.
This course is designed to provide a strong grounded understanding of behaviors in organizations. Through the science of Organizational Behavior, students will acquire the body of knowledge to develop key managerial and leadership competencies required to interact and work effectively with superiors, peers and subordinates.

Studies revealed that new leadership theories were emerging and demands on leaders are changing. According to studies, only 21% of leaders are prepared for emerging changes.  Leadership Agility is one key success factor identified for higher employee engagement, team performance, organizational commitment, and job satisfaction. Global economics is a social science that deals with resource creation, distribution and consumption in the world. Because it is about people and the real world, Global Economics enables students to learn about banking, finance, globalization, and broader social issues such as poverty, education, health and the global environment. It is a versatile discipline closely linked to politics, sociology, psychology, business and finance.
This course focuses primarily on its application of theory and quantitative methods to contemporary economic problems. It helps students to think logically, rationally and rigorously. Upon completion, students will be able to understand and analyse the trends and driving forces of the global economy.

Successful applications include customer segmentation and classification, profile analysis, cross-selling, churn analysis, credit scoring, fraud detection, etc.
In this course, students will be able to view data analytics and decision-making as the discovery of interesting patterns in data that can be used to describe or summarize the data and to predict future instances of the data. Such patterns are considered to be knowledge discovered and important for strategic decisions. Students will also be guided to build different data analytic tools such as ChatGPT to mine and analyse real data sets, such as financial data or retail data for decision-making.

Product Management forms the backbone of all businesses. FAQs.title: FAQs
FAQs.content:
Programme
The NTU-IMBA is a part-time programme.
Min. candidature: 15 months
Max. candidature: 60 months
Classes will be delivered in a hybrid format with in-class sessions at UEH campus in Ho Chi Minh City and live sessions conducted via Zoom. The programme also comes with global immersion trips.
You may view details of the Tuition Fee
here
.
Nanyang Business School of NTU Singapore has achieved both
AACSB
and
EQUIS
accreditations. The AACSB and EQUIS accreditations are significant benchmarks for evaluating the quality of MBA programmes globally. Here are the reasons why these accreditations are important considerations when selecting an MBA programme:
Quality Assurance
: AACSB accreditation is a signal of high-quality standards in business education.
Comprehensive Evaluation
: Accreditation involves a thorough evaluation of a business school's teaching, faculty, services, and student quality. This comprehensive review ensures that the institution meets global standards of excellence​​.
Continuous Improvement
: Accredited schools are committed to continuous improvement. They regularly undergo evaluations and reviews to maintain their accreditation status. This ensures that the school remains up to date with the latest developments in business education and maintains a high standard of quality.
Global Recognition
: AACSB and EQUIS are recognized worldwide. If you plan to pursue a career in business or work internationally, having a degree from an accredited business school can enhance your credibility and marketability. Employers and organizations often value graduates from accredited institutions because they know that these graduates have received a comprehensive and reputable education.
Minimum Entry Requirements
Bachelor's Degree from a recognised university
At least three (3) years of professional experience
Submit Executive Assessment (EA) result
TOEFL score > 100 IBT or IELTS score > 6.5, if English was not the medium of instruction used at the undergraduate level
Candidates need to possess a recognised Bachelor's degree to be eligible for the IMBA programme.

Applications
There is only one intake per academic year.
We only accept applications submitted via our
online application system
.
You are not required to be a Vietnamese to apply for the IMBA programme. However, it is recommended that you reside in Vietnam as majority of the classes will be conducted at UEH campus in Ho Chi Minh City.
Please view the application deadlines
here
.

Submitted applications will be reviewed and a notification email will be sent to you if your application is missing some documents. Assessment begins after the application deadline of each round. You will be notified if you have been shortlisted for an interview within 4 to 6 weeks after the application deadline of the round which you have applied to.
You may track the status of your application by logging to the
online application system
with your username and password.

For assistance, please contact our IMBA team at
[email protected]
with your name and application number.
Only shortlisted candidates will be required to go through an interview. You will be informed via email if you have been shortlisted.

online application system
for their application status.

scholarships-grant-and-subsidy.title: Scholarships and Financial Support
scholarships-grant-and-subsidy.content:
We encourage early application, as scholarships and financial support are given on a rolling basis and competition is keen.
Scholarships
Eligibility criteria for scholarships application:
Candidates who are offered admission into the AY2026 intake of IMBA programme.
Additional essays and interviews are required and will be used as part of the assessment for the scholarship award.
Candidates are allowed to apply for more than one scholarship. However, only one scholarship may be awarded to the candidate. The awarded amount is
up to SGD 10,000 per scholarship
.
Stipend Support
Eligibility criteria for stipend application:
Candidates residing 100km or more from Ho Chi Minh City are eligible to apply.
Candidates need to be residents of Vietnam.
Submission of proof of registered address of residence is required.
The stipend is to support these candidates with expenses for transport and accommodation to attend the in-class sessions in Ho Chi Minh City.
Candidates will need to submit an estimated breakdown of their transportation and accommodation expenses for attending the in-class sessions. This estimate should be provided along with their application for stipend support.
Alumni Grant for NTU and UEH Alumni
Students are entitled to a 10% tuition fee discount under the following conditions:
The applicants have
previously completed
an
undergraduate or postgraduate
degree programme with
Nanyang Technological University (NTU) or University of Economics Ho Chi Minh City (UEH).
IMBA Referral Grant
We value the strength of our alumni network and the trust our graduates place in the programme. New participants referred by an IMBA alumni or current IMBA participant are eligible for a one-time grant of $5,000 off tuition fees (before prevailing GST). This grant applies strictly to tuition fees and does not cover other programme-related costs.
The referrer will be required to complete a recommendation report to confirm the relationship
Alumni of Singapore’s Autonomous University Grant
The applicants have previously completed an undergraduate or postgraduate degree programme with the following Singapore’s autonomous universities: National University of Singapore (NUS), Singapore Management University (SMU), Singapore University of Social Sciences (SUSS), Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD), or Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) are eligible for this grant.
This is a one-time grant of $5,000 off tuition fees (before prevailing GST). This grant applies strictly to tuition fees and does not cover other programme-related costs
Lifelong Learning Subsidy for Singaporeans, and PRs
To encourage lifelong learning and make postgraduate education more accessible, we offer a SGD 5,000 subsidy to all Singaporeans and Permanent Residents (PRs) applying for the IMBA intake in AY2026.
Corporate Subsidy
We encourage prospective candidates to engage their organisations early to explore support options—whether in the form of full or partial sponsorship, or flexible work arrangements during your studies. Preferential corporate rate may apply for applicants admitted with corporate support. To learn more, contact us for a personalised consultation.
Conditions for all scholarships and financial support schemes:
Grants/discounts/subsidy/ stipend support are deducted equally across 4 instalments;
Scholarships are deducted in the last instalment and awardees need to fulfil GPA requirement;
Students can apply for maximum 2 forms of financial support;
The total stackable awarded amount of Scholarships, Stipend Support, Grant, Subsidy, Corporate subsidy per candidate
cannot be more than 20%
of the programme fee.
Skills Future Credit
SkillsFuture Credit aims to encourage individual ownership of skills development and lifelong learning. Starting from January 2016, all Singaporeans aged 25 and above will receive an initial credit of S$500. Furthermore, Singaporeans aged 40 and above will receive a top-up of S$4,000. You can use SkillsFuture Credit to offset the tuition fee, depending on your SkillsFuture Credit balance and age at the time of enrolment in the programme.
For more information on the SkillsFuture Level-Up Programme for aged 40 and above, please click
here
for more information.
The NTU International MBA programme is a certified course under this programme. Please click
here
for more information on the disbursement of the credit.

student-testimonial.title: Student Experience
student-testimonial.content:
What’s it like to be part of our programme? Explore testimonials from students and alumni to see how it can shape your future.
Singapore
Nelson Wu
Managing Director, Vietjet Air Cargo
This iMBA programme has exceeded my expectations with its well-prepared content, hybrid knowledge delivery methods, highly interactive and engaging class discussions, and the exceptional quality of my classmates. It reflects NTU’s commitment to maintaining high academic standards and providing students with an outstanding learning experience
Vietnam
Tran Vu Hien
Chief Finance Officer,
Asia Commercial Bank (ACB)
It has been a wonderful experience so far. I get to meet amazing classmates and professors, friendly and helpful staff members. The learning experience has been great and I am very eager to look forward to the rest of the programme.
Vietnam
Nguyen Tran Nam
Managing Director of Digital Banking Division, Asia Commercial Bank (ACB)
The programme is worth every penny. It’s simply beyond my expectations.
Singapore
Chua Mengzhi
Senior Manager, Ernst & Young (EY)
The programme has been excellent thus far, featuring a diverse mix of participants from various backgrounds and levels of experience. We have been provided with numerous opportunities to network and engage in meaningful conversations with professors, business leaders, and industry professionals. Additionally, the programme has included several company visits, allowing us to gain valuable insights into different business operations and practices.
Singapore
Dennis Sim Wuen Hau
Deputy General Director, Vietubes Corporation Ltd
A great IMBA for aspiring future leaders!  The programme encompasses the many facets needed to manage a company in a senior leadership positions. Additionally, the modules on AI and sustainability are a must to understand the evolving business environment.
Singapore
Jefferey Lee Meng Toong
Director, A8 Resource Company Limited
I value the insights obtained from the professors during the face-to-face sessions as it's been a long time since I stepped into a university lecture room. And kudos to the programme management team for supporting the IMBA students throughout the four days in Singapore which is important to build up the momentum
Singapore
Tran Anh Van
Director of Global Accounts, Starcirle
Just wrapped up an unforgettable week to kick start my NTU International MBA journey! From an awesome orientation that set the tone, to engaging lessons that sparked new ideas, this experience has already been incredibly enriching. Add to that an incredible cohort of driven, talented individuals and fun team-building activities that strengthened bonds—it’s been an exciting beginning to this new chapter.
Vietnam
Vo Thi Minh Ly
HR Director, Cho Tot — A subsidiary of Carousell Group
Being part of the NTU IMBA pioneer batch has been both exciting and rewarding. The diverse cohort creates a dynamic learning atmosphere, enhancing the experience. The faculty is highly experienced and dedicated to our success, providing valuable insights that are directly applicable to real-world business challenges. This programme offers a transformative journey that equips students with the skills and knowledge necessary to thrive in the global business landscape
Singapore
New Kheng Tiong
Director, Astute Global Management Pte. Ltd.
I believe the IMBA would pave the way for Singapore and Vietnam business leaders to gain a competitive edge to lead and conduct business in Singapore, Vietnam and across Asia.
Vietnam
Le Thi Trang
Vice President, Corporate Communications & CSR, Keppel Vietnam
The MBA programme will be equipping me with a diverse skill set and a broader perspective on business operations. As I aim to advance into a senior leadership role, I recognize the need to strengthen my strategic thinking and financial acumen. The rigorous curriculum will challenge me to think critically and prepare me for complex decision-making
Vietnam
Do Duong Bao Ngoc
Country Head of Vietnam, InMobi Advertising
I'm totally impressed by the high quality standards of the course, and how dedicated the professors, the staffs and all the program supporters were. I wasn't expected to have a lot of reflections, growth and learning at this high bar. This has become one of the most well-spent investments for education in my life. Thank you IMBA@NTU!
Vietnam
Pham Ha Trang
Senior Manager, PD People Capability Development, Prudential Vietnam
The first segment was an eye-opening experience. The most rewarding part of the journey came from the high-quality interaction among various stakeholders in the programme: passionate professors, authentic speakers, and experienced, highly engaged participants. Immersed in such an inspiring environment, you couldn’t help but participate fully and let the learning unfold every moment. The industry visits to some of the largest technology companies placed me in some new, transformative world, urging me to learn and change.
Taiwan
Jeffrey Wei Lin
Merchandise Manager, Far Eastern Apparel (Vietnam) LTD
This programme is 10/10. Phenomenal experience from curriculum designed (hybrid + on site) to faculty member staff (professional expertise + fascinating personal charisma). The IMBA team really deep dive into Vietnam market & several Industry trends before setting up this programme. This IMBA courses contain current hot topics, business norm and future trend which taught by elite faculty member with diversified background. The onsite segment is such a great opportunity to help us understand NTU (campus, history) Singapore (how it became the new Asia Hub) and each other.
India
Himanshu Singh
Technical Manager - APAC, Excelerate Energy Asia Pacific Pte. Ltd.
The NTU IMBA programme has been an incredible journey of growth and learning. The world class faculty and resources with the diverse cohort brings a wealth of perspectives, enriching discussions and fostering a truly global mindset. The curriculum is well-rounded, with a perfect blend of academic rigor and real-world applications, preparing us to tackle challenges in today's dynamic business environment. I highly recommend this programme to aspiring professionals looking to elevate their careers and broaden their horizons.
Vietnam
Do Thi Ngoc Mai
Talent Management (senior expert), One Mount Group
The knowledgeable and inspiring professors, the excellent and experienced peers, and the blend of academic content with industrial visits, these bring so much practical insights and they make the class really exciting and fun. I hope to connect more with career support, and learn more from them as well.
Vietnam
Hoai Viet Duc
Expense Management Manager, Prudential
My experience in the IMBA programme has been truly rewarding. First of all, I’ve had the opportunity to network with incredible individuals from Vietnam and Singapore, gaining insights from their deep expertise. Secondly, learning from top-tier professors has been a transformative and inspiring experience. Thirdly, the company visits provided eye-opening exposure to how leading corporations operate. Lastly, the unwavering support and kindness of the IMBA team have left a lasting impression on me. The experience so far has exceeded my expectations in every way!
Vietnam
Nguyen Le Minh Hang
Customer Marketing Manager, GSK
What stands out most is how NTU professors expertly crafted a program with incredible breadth and depth, directly enabling better business decisions. The exceptional class cohorts are a huge bonus, pushing the boundaries of learning and very creative application even further. An absolute 10/10!
Vietnam
Pham Ngoc Thanh
Platform Manager, Momo
The IMBA programme is a transformative experience! It equips me with practical skills, strategic thinking, and a global perspective on business, tech, and sustainability. The diverse cohort and expert faculty create an inspiring environment for self-discovery, learning, collaboration, and personal growth. The first segment in Singapore was unique, giving us a chance to learn more about NTU and experience the academic environment there.
Vietnam
To Thanh Tung
Investor Relations Manager, Timo Digital Bank - Timo Vietnam JSC
The NTU IMBA is an advanced MBA programme concentrating on sustainability, leveraging cutting-edge technologies such as AI, machine learning, and big data to cultivate leaders capable of making a significant contribution to their businesses and the broader corporate landscape. Learners are mentored by leading professors and field experts to realise a forward-thinking vision for the business world.
India
Sunbin Varadarajan
Manager, Supply Chain Control Tower, DB Schenker Singapore
Being part of a reputed Business School like NBS, we not only learnt the qualities of a successful leader from a group of amazing professors, but each one of us have also become a part of its growth story. There are very few moments in one’s life when one feels to be genuinely fortunate.
Vietnam
Bui Phuong Thao
Deputy Manager, Keppel Land
It was an honor to experience and receive the value sharing from all the seniors, through this I was able to understand more how important this programme was. With all the new knowledge coming, I believe i will be more productive and professional in my field.
Vietnam
Ho Thi Phuong Thao
Senior Director, Head of Non-FI Sales, Visa Vietnam and Laos
One term into the NTU IMBA program, and I’m amazed at how much I’ve learned. The mix of rigorous coursework and real-world projects has pushed me out of my comfort zone and broadened my perspective. What stands out most is the diversity in the classroom, learning alongside talented peers from different cultures has been inspiring. This experience is not just about business; it’s about leadership, adaptability, and building connections that last. Excited for the journey ahead!
Vietnam
Dinh Hai Yen
HRBP Manager - Vietnam Customer Operations, Procurement and R&D, Unilever Vietnam
I believe this is one of the most wise decision when choosing to pursue IMBA in Nanyang. This program itself has tailor-made perfectly for people who are still in progress with their career. It's a balanced mix between exposure to NTU's facilities and experience as a full-time student with ability to learn hybrid.
Vietnam
Ngo Thi Soa
Group Manager, Head of Game Studio 9, VNG Corporation
It has been a great experience so far. The module was very well-arranged, and the NTU team ensured every moment in Singapore was meaningful and worthwhile. Prof Lewis was incredibly funny, and Prof Vis was deeply passionate. Both classes were insightful and inspiring, and the fireside chat plus industry visits were highly relatable to our learning content.
Vietnam
Vu Minh Nhat
Director, Services, Phong Vu Computer
Such an impressed and enjoyable first sessions in the NTU IMBA program. Harvested lots of knowledge and team collaboration activities in all classes. Learned a lot from Professors, guest speakers and all classmates.
Vietnam
Tran Trong Tan Khoa
Integrated Marketing Senior Executive, Vietjet Air
The IMBA programme has already offered meaningful learning experiences that connect theory with real-world practice. The company visits especially helped me sharpen my understanding of innovation, leadership, and sustainability from a managerial perspective. I’ve benefited greatly from the diverse cohort, the collaborative learning environment, and the programme’s focus on practical application. These early experiences have strengthened my strategic thinking and broadened my outlook, giving me confidence for the journey ahead.
Vietnam
Huynh Ngoc Khanh Ngan
Business Owner, Hiep Hung Steel Co. Ltd (Dong Nai, Vietnam)
The classmates are very energetic, outgoing, and brilliant, which enriches the learning environment. I also enjoyed the lectures; the professors offered fresh perspectives that broadened my understanding (some of the ideas were indeed extremely helpful to me as a business owner).
Thailand
Sarin Ye
Business Owner, Circle Cafe & Co-working Space
Director, SM Community Mall Bangkok.
Joining IMBA is one of the great decisions I've made in my life. Not only NTU is the world-ranked university, but what NTU offers is far beyond my expectations. I was really impressed by the curriculum, activities, and exceptional classmates. So far, I truly believe that attending IMBA is the right investment on myself and I really looking forward on this journey.
Vietnam
Le Viet Ha
Director of Winter Wolf Studio, IEC Games, Hanoi
My experience in the IMBA programme so far has been excellent. The professors have been friendly, enthusiastic, and dedicated. They have guided us a great deal, not only in our academic subjects but also in real-life matters. The teaching assistants have also been enthusiastic and professional. They supported us tremendously throughout the first days of the programme in Singapore, when we had just stepped into a new country and environment.
Vietnam
Nguyen Thi Phuong Tu
Founder & CEO, Queen Pack Co. Ltd
The NTU experience exceeded my expectations. I learned from professors and experts who shared the latest global knowledge and research, especially on sustainable development, which is still new in Vietnam. The teaching methods were modern, combining theory with leading research papers. The university offered us opportunities to visit major companies in Singapore and worldwide, showing how concepts are applied in practice. Studying on the net-zero campus, with green, modern, and airy spaces, and supportive staff, was truly inspiring. I am grateful for these experiences and will apply them as much as possible in my current work.
Vietnam
Nguyen Van Long
Founder & Director, KVY Tech Co. Ltd
I would say immersive experience. IMBA program challenge me to step out of my comfort zone. Even though I'm still in the beginning of the IMBA journey but I truly believe it will help me to become the leader that I want to be.
Vietnam
Nguyen Huu Anh Hao
Founder & Chief Revenue Officer, DGV Digital
The campus and facilities are absolutely amazing with modern classrooms, cozy study spaces, and a library I never want to leave. The professors and support team are super warm and always ready to help. My classmates are smart, fun people from different industry and expertise background, and learning together feels exciting every day. Honestly, I’m really happy and proud to be part of this program!
Vietnam
Mai Van Tham
Specialty Care Marketing Lead, Pfizer Vietnam
The first IMBA segment at NTU were an exhilarating, emotional climax. I poured my hearts into high-stakes case resolutions on innovation and sustainability, forging unbreakable bonds with the IMBA fellow across countries. Crucial, inspiring sessions with industry titans gave my raw, future-focused insights. Leaving NTU brought a powerful, unshakeable surge of confidence, knowing we are fully prepared and empowered to lead the change for a sustainable future.
Vietnam
Truong Tuyet Ngoc
Head of Technology Procurement, Galaxy Digital Holdings
This is a globally competitive program that upholds the high academic standards while equipping leaders with the essential knowledge needed to navigate and thrive in a new era marked by profound uncertainty.
Vietnam
Nguyen Pham Thanh Ha
Vietnam Country Manager, Cintana Education
The first few days of the IMBA program have been incredibly inspiring and energising. Every group discussion, lecture, and guest presentation has broadened my perspective and reaffirmed why I chose this program. I’m very excited to continue this learning journey alongside my wonderful 2025 cohort.
Singapore
Wong Chen Li
Cybersecurity Analyst, Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)
Thoroughly enjoyed this orientation prepared by the IMBA administrators. We got to be exposed to industry leaders and engaged in meaningful conversations that spurred our thought process as we look at business and an organisation at a higher level.
Vietnam
Do Thi Tuyet
HR Business Partner, HR Division, VPBank Hanoi
Joining the IMBA Cohort 25 immersion session at Nanyang Business School, NTU was an unforgettable experience. The combination of strategic insights, innovation, and practical learning set the tone for what I know will be an impactful journey ahead. This program is an excellent choice for professionals aiming to lead transformation with confidence.
Vietnam
Bui Thi Anh Ngoc
HR Lead, IEC Corporation
For me, IMBA is the best fit because:
I can experience an academic environment at one of the top universities in the world.
I am able to follow the program while continuing my current job, without having to leave my home country.
I have the chance to learn about global trends while at the same time understanding the local market context.
After networking with other students in class, I realised that my classmates are incredibly talented and have a strong passion for learning. Therefore, I hope we can work together and support one another to achieve our goals throughout the rest of the course.
Vietnam
Ngo Thuy Ngoc Tam
Assistant Manager, Customer Experience, Shopee Vietnam
The IMBA programme has been a very rewarding experience so far. I’ve especially enjoyed the focus on sustainability and how different countries and organizations are approaching the green and digital economy. The classes are practical, with discussions and assignments that feel close to real business situations. I’ve been able to bring ideas from class back to my job straight away, and it’s helped me look at problems in a more structured and global way.
Vietnam
Doan Thi Hoai Thu
Senior Finance Manager, Axinan Vietnam (Igloo Vietnam)
The IMBA programme has been an inspiring journey, especially through the sharing of top leaders from highly successful companies. Their experiences showed me how sustainability can be embedded in any organisation through simple, practical initiatives - starting with understanding operations, identifying bottlenecks, and improving consistently. The visit to Marina Barrage and Singapore’s long-term water strategy further reinforced the philosophy: “imagine it, decide it, and make it happen.” These lessons have deeply shaped my mindset, both professionally and personally.
Vietnam
Mai Tung Lam
Project Manager, Techcombank Hanoi
I found myself within a warm welcome from one of the top universities in the world. The campus was beautiful, facilities are state-of-the-art, staff are soooo friendly, helpful and caring. And on top of that, my met my dear classmates. Trust me, you can hardly see a group of such amazing people anywhere else. Each one came with their own unique story, embedded with victories and losses, and you can easily see the experience, the knowledge and the greatness in each of everyone. Being here with those kind of people for the next 15 months is a privilege that I will treasure every day.
Vietnam
Nguyen Thu Van
Lead Global Business Development, GIANTY – Japanese Entertainment Tech Company
The IMBA program truly amazed me. Our cohort comes from diverse industries and roles, which brings fresh perspectives, not only in knowledge, but also in mindset and problem-solving approach. The take-home assignments and in-class exercises are practical, challenging us to think deeper and apply concepts immediately. The learning style is dynamic, engaging, and perfectly suited for working professionals. I’m grateful for how much this program has broadened my thinking.
Vietnam
Ngo Thi Xuan Mai
Product Manager – Acquisition Financial Products, Home Credit Vietnam
The program has pushed me to grow professionally and personally, giving me the confidence to lead with clarity and purpose. This journey has not only expanded my career opportunities but also reshaped the way I see innovation, teamwork, and impact in today’s dynamic business world
Vietnam
Vu Ngoc Quang
Associate Portfolio Manager, Vietnam Oman Investment
The NTU IMBA programme has been transformative yet practical. The curriculum balances academic rigour with real-world relevance, while the diverse cohort offers invaluable perspectives. As a Portfolio Manager at Vietnam Oman Investment Fund, I appreciate how the programme refines both strategic thinking and execution discipline. In the upcoming time I would love to disscover more on new topics such as Tech, AI, Blockchain... Finally, the support of the programme office has been very useful for students.
Vietnam
Nguyen Tung Duong
Assistant Manager, Budget & Planning Projects, Shopee Food -  Shopee Vietnam
The IMBA programme at NTU has been eye-opening and energizing. From learning about real sustainability projects in Singapore to engaging with a diverse and talented cohort, I’ve gained new knowledge, inspiration, and clarity on how I can contribute more meaningfully to society. It’s been an invaluable step in both my personal and professional development.
Vietnam
Ngo Hoang Nhan
BIM Services Manager, Simpson Strongtie Vietnam
After years in engineering and team management, I felt the need to step out of my comfort zone and challenge myself in new ways. The IMBA has been exactly that. The discussions, group work, and diverse perspectives push me to think bigger and lead with more confidence. Every module gives me tools I can immediately apply to improve how I support teams and projects. This experience is shaping me into the strategic leader I aim to become.
Vietnam
Nguyen Kim Ngan
Digital Sales Manager, Home Credit Vietnam
If you register for the Nanyang IMBA program, then be ready for a 15-month extraordinary journey. You will become part of Singapore’s green economy ecosystem, where government, business, and education work hand in hand to build a sustainable future. You will also join a community you are proud of, one filled with passionate, curious professionals from diverse industries and countries, all eager to learn, share, and grow together. I promise, every discussion will open your mind to new ways of thinking about business, sustainability, and leadership. For me, It is more than a program, it is an experience that challenges you, connects you, and prepares you to lead with purpose in the digital era.
Vietnam

overseas-immersion-segment.title: Overseas Immersion Segment
overseas-immersion-segment.content:
The International MBA (IMBA) programme distinguishes itself with its
Overseas Immersion Segments
, a transformative learning journey where students engage directly with global leaders, top corporations, and cutting-edge research institutions.
This experience equips students with real-world insights, leadership perspectives, and industry connections that extend far beyond the classroom.
Amazon Web Services (AWS): Learning Innovation from Top Industry Players
At the
AWS Asia Pacific Hub
, International MBA students gain unparalleled access to the world’s leading cloud solutions provider, a privilege made possible through NTU’s global reputation and strong corporate connections.
Few institutions can open doors at this level, but NTU ensures its students engage directly with leaders shaping the future of business and technology.
By engaging with these leaders, students don’t just study innovation, they witness it in practice, learn how it is embedded into corporate culture, and develop the mindset to translate an
innovation-first approach
into their own leadership journey.
Sandesh Menon, Head of ASEAN Enterprise Greenfield Business
Shares how AWS differentiates itself in a highly competitive market, giving students a clear view of what sets world-class companies apart
Harley Young, Head of Technology
Introduces Amazon’s distinctive culture and leadership principles, revealing how they drive high-performing teams and effective decision-making at scale
Girish Dilip, Head of Generative AI Technology
Provides insight into how technological acumen, AI innovation, and digital transformation are redefining competitive advantage in the global economy
CyberSG R&D Programme Office (CRPO): Cybersecurity Research and Innovation
The CRPO is a national centre at NTU that aims to propel Singapore to the forefront of cybersecurity innovation and implementation, backed by S$62 million in funding from the Cyber Security Agency of Singapore (CSA).
Cybersecurity research and innovation are vital to a digital economy because they protect critical infrastructure and business operations from cyber threats, foster trust in digital services, and enable safe technological advancement.
The International MBA students get to experience this
critical pillar
of a
thriving digital economy
through a sharing and visit to one of the national labs, iTrust, SUTD, arranged by the CRPO.
Dr Chia Chien Wei, Chief-of-Staff CRPO, NTU
Provides insight into cybersecurity research and innovation initiatives and NTU’s strategic role in CyberSG
The International MBA students being briefed on one of the several world-class testbeds and training platforms hosted by iTrust. These testbeds and training platforms together constitute a one-of-a kind facility for research and training in the design of safe and secure large-scale cyber-physical systems
Fireside Chat: Sustainability in the Green and Digital Economy
During the Fireside Chat, IMBA students had the opportunity to hear directly from top leaders in their fields to provide an unparalleled way to understand how to think strategically, make decisions, and drive business growth with a focus on sustainability in the green and digital economy.
The session concluded with an
exclusive networking dinner
, where students could continue conversations with speakers, alumni, and peers transforming insights into meaningful connections.
This unique experience is made possible only through
NTU’s strong reputation and its connections to industry leaders at the highest level.
Lam Sheau Kai, President of SMRT Trains
Titus Yong, CEO of SPTel
Kenneth Tan, Deputy Executive Director of Octave Institute.
Porsche Studio Asia Pacific: Branding and Customer Experience
An inside look at
Porsche Asia Pacific
gives International MBA students an exclusive opportunity to experience how one of the world’s most iconic luxury brands sustains its leadership.
At
Porsche Studio Singapore
, students gain a powerful lesson in
strategy, storytelling, and customer experience
, seeing firsthand how a legendary brand translates vision into long-term success.
Hannes Ruoff, CEO of Porsche Asia Pacific
Delivers an inspiring presentation on how Porsche drives sustainable growth in highly competitive markets like Singapore while preserving its brand identity
Brendan Mok, Head of PR & Communications
Brings brand philosophy to life through tours, curated experiences, and storytelling that show how Porsche designs customer journeys built on emotion and loyalty
Here’s what Porsche Asia Pacific Pte Ltd shared about our visit:
"We welcomed students from NTU's International MBA programme in Vietnam to explore how Porsche continues to redefine the future of automotive retail, while still staying true to its rich heritage and spirit of forward-looking innovation. Just like how our founder Ferry Porsche forged his own vision to create a dream sports car, we look forward to the value these leaders will create tomorrow."
Building Connections Beyond the Classroom
The IMBA journey is not only about learning from world-class faculty and industry leaders, but also about
forging meaningful connections with peers who share the same drive and mindset
.
One highlight was a BBQ party generously hosted by an IMBA student, where classmates, professors and friends came together in a warm and informal setting.
Over good food and music, we drank, sang, laughed, and shared stories. These moments of joy and deep conversation created memories that go beyond the classroom. They offered fresh perspectives, helping us
reshape our thinking and broaden our worldview.
This is the essence of the IMBA experience:
a community that grows, learns and celebrates together.
What do our students say?
For many, the Overseas Immersion was not just about classes or company visits, it was a moment of discovery. Students came back with new ideas, deeper friendships, and memories that will last a lifetime. Here’s what IMBA students shared about their experience, in their own words:

title: MSc Accountancy
description:
The MSc in Accountancy (MACC) programme at Nanyang Business School leverages the school's long tradition and successful track record in training executives in accounting and finance-related fields. Each year, we admit students
with a keen interest and enthusiasm to deepen their accountancy skills and knowledge, and to advance their careers in Singapore and beyond.
Our MACC programme is a 12-month full time programme offering two distinct tracks: General and Data Analytics.
MSc Accountancy with two tracks options:
MSc Accountancy (General Track)
The MACC General track is designed to provide you with a comprehensive understanding of the fast-evolving global business and accounting landscape, leveraging technology and advanced analytical techniques to equip you for a successful career in professional
accounting.

programme-overview.content:
Designed to fast-track professional growth in accounting and finance, the MSc in Accountancy (MACC) at Nanyang Business School, Singapore's first established accounting school offers 2 tracks: General and Data Analytics (DA), tailored to align with your
post Masters career aspirations. Regardless of the track you choose, the comprehensive curriculum can be completed within one year on a full-time basis.
For module descriptions, please refer to the
Module Information
. Upon successful completion of the DA track, the specialisation will be reflected in the academic transcript.
The MACC programme is offered in 12 months with 2 tracks: General and Data Analytics. The programme is delivered entirely in English on the vibrant main campus at Nanyang Technological University in Singapore.

With AI and Automation fast changing the world of accounting, we have updated our curriculum to include Data Analytics & Machine Learning for Accounting, as well as Forensic Accounting and Digital Forensics.
In total, the MSc in Accountancy curriculum at Nanyang Business School consists of 18  modules:
Accounting for Decision Making and Control
Accounting Recognition and Measurement
Assurance and Auditing
Ai in Accounting and Finance
Business Analysis and Equity Valuation
Company Law and Corporate Governance
Data Analytics & Machine Learning for Accounting​
Designing and Developing Databases
ESG and Sustainability Reporting
Enterprise Risk Management
Financial Accounting
Financial Management
Forensic accounting and Digital Forensics
Management of Legal Obligations in Business
Risk Reporting and Analysis
Strategic Management
Tax Management
Visual and Predictive Analytics
At the end of this programme, you will be able to successfully master the language of business and finance. You will also be able to gain direct access to the Professional Programme of the Singapore Chartered Accountant qualification.
The aim of this course is to introduce you to the design and use of management accounting information for planning, control, and decision making within business organisations.
The major topics covered in this course include product costing, activity-based costing and management, strategic cost management practices, transfer pricing issues, tools for decision making, such as cost- volume-profit (CVP) analysis, and performance evaluation and measurement issues, including sustainability measurement.
This course equips you with strong conceptual and technical knowledge of the recognition and measurement of various financial statement elements.
The course begins with a discussion of objectives of financial reporting and general recognition, as well as measurement issues and concepts. It provides you with a critical examination of recognition and measurement issues and authoritative pronouncements related to various elements of the financial statements.
Topics include fair value measurement, leases, financial instruments, deferred taxes, revenue recognition, construction contracts, and share-based payments.
This course provides you with an in-depth understanding of key assurance concepts and methodologies, as well as the skills and attitudes essential to the effective and efficient conduct of financial statements audits and assurance services.
In
terms of pedagogy, this course emphasizes active learning at both individual and group levels through project work, seminar discussions, and activities. The course is designed to inculcate in you critical knowledge, skills, and attitudes that an effective
assurance professional should possess.
Critical skills that are developed and reinforced through the various course activities include problem solving, critical thinking, research, communication, teamwork, and interpersonal skills.
Important attitudes and values that this course aims to impart include professional values and ethics, social responsibility, receptiveness to differing views, healthy scepticism, and a passion for proactive self-learning.
This course will equip you with the ability to create customised solutions to make informed business decisions, integrate statistical libraries for data analysis and create AI models to automate accounting and financial processes. It will provide you
with individual hands-on practice to hone your coding skills and also opportunities to develop coding solutions in a team. The course utilises R and Python language as the medium of learning because it is one of the most in-demand coding languages and
its user-friendly syntax is well suited for beginners. You will also utilise modern development tools to turn information into insights including Keras, Deep Learning model, Google Brain TensorFlow, Hadoop, Spark and Cloud.
The course focuses on identifying, assessing, and applying information for the purposes of analysing and valuing business activities and entities. The course employs the agency framework within a capital market context to help students develop the necessary
analysis and valuation skills. You will learn about the roles of accounting and the implications of Financial Accounting for capital market efficiency.
Cases and projects are used to help you integrate the accounting, capital market efficiency, business analysis, and valuation concepts.  Healthy scepticism is emphasized, as you will be encouraged to challenge the assumptions and facts related to each
issue.
Whether you aim to become accounting or business professionals, have entrepreneurial or managerial aspirations, or will be succeeding to a family business, it is essential for you to develop a grounded understanding of the legal and regulatory mechanisms
that govern companies.
In this course, you will learn about the legal framework and laws governing how companies are constituted, the relationship between its various stakeholders, corporate governance mechanisms, corporate finance, and insolvency; and how to apply these laws
to problems modelled on real-world scenarios. This course will equip you to identify and avert a range of frequently encountered legal problems.
There has been an exponential growth of data over the past decade that can provide organisations the opportunities to derive insights to better support their decision making. Similarly in the field of accountancy, the use of Data Analytics is likely to have a great impact on how accountants and auditors work in this modern economy.
This course introduces you to
the key concepts of predictive analytics and the course will cover the processes and tools relating to Data Analytics. Using real-life case studies, you will be given the opportunity to gain hands-on experience on building analytical models that will guide decision marking for various business problems such as fraud detection, profit and revenue forecast, customer segmentation, and trend analysis.
This course will lay the foundation that will systematically introduce the process of developing a strong business analytic case starting from the exploration of the data context to finally obtaining the explanatory or predictive results. You will learn how to ask the right questions and how to draw inferences from the data by using the appropriate statistical and data mining tools. ​
Through this course, you will understand how databases support business processes and gather information for business analytics. In particular, you will be able to apply the knowledge and skills to analyse a variety of business processes, identify data
requirements, and create corresponding data management strategies.
With the global push for enterprise sustainability and the benefits that sustainability reporting brings to both investors and companies, many companies now prepare an annual sustainability report to describe the organisation’s sustainability practices
that encapsulates environmental, social, and governance (ESG) themes.
Enterprise sustainability creates long-term value beyond financial success by making a positive impact socially as well as environmentally. As climate change and global warming pose an existential threat to humanity and affect all industry sectors, there
is an urgent need for businesses to monitor and seek innovative green solutions to reduce their carbon footprints and to deliver on their targeted net-zero goals. Students will learn key concepts and apply widely-adopted methodologies of carbon management,
sustainability reporting and assurance.
To sustain value, corporations today recognize the need for active engagement in setting objectives and overseeing programs associated with Enterprise Risk Management (ERM). This shift in paradigm is driven by increasing stakeholder demands and performance
expectations as well as growing public scrutiny after some spectacular corporate failures around the globe. Hence, this course provides course participants with an overview of risks that can threaten the attainment of organizational objectives, and
the ERM concepts, frameworks and techniques for identifying, assessing and managing risks. Participants will also be exposed to hands-on data analytics application in the areas of business risks, fraud risks and audit analytics.
This course focuses on key principles and concepts in financial accounting and the application of these concepts in business decision making. A strategic framework for accounting is adopted with emphasis on a user/decision-maker perspective.
The course covers the foundations of accounting theory, conventional measurement techniques, reporting procedures, and relevant accounting standards. The main focus will be on International Financial Reporting Standards and Singapore Financial Reporting Standards.
An important feature of this course is the extensive use of current business articles and cases dealing with contemporary issues in financial accounting.
The objective of this course is to provide a rigorous introduction to the foundations of financial management in competitive financial markets. The course is designed to equip you with the basic tools that are necessary in managing a firm in a dynamic financial environment.
The topics to be covered include the time value of money, risk and return, portfolio management, stock and bond valuation, cost of capital, capital budgeting, capital structure, dividend policy, corporate financing, agency theory, and financial derivatives.
Strategic applications of these concepts to real world problems will be given equal emphasis. The method of instruction, depending on the topic, will include lectures, case studies, and/or other pedagogical tools.
This course will introduce the concept of forensic accounting and the role of a forensic accountant. The course will cover different types of fraud schemes as well as various investigation techniques and tools. It will explore the key trends and
developments in the forensic accounting field and provide practical insights on detecting fraud and other economic crime.
A digital forensics methodology will be introduced with an overview of e-discovery, email review and forensics Data Analytics. Using real-life case studies, you will be given the opportunity to demonstrate how theoretical frameworks and concepts
in forensic accounting can be applied in the real world.​
This half-course focuses on the management of key aspects of legal obligations in business. It will begin with an introduction to the Singapore legal system and regulatory framework for doing business. It will give you an understanding of obligations in key business torts and contracts before introducing various legal tools commonly used to manage the obligations and strategies that enable contracting parties to best protect their interests. And will conclude with an examination of the legal issues when contracting through agents.
At the end of the course, you will:
Have an understanding of the key legal considerations in doing business
Be able to analyse and manage key aspects of contracts and the contracting process
Be able to understand and explain how specific business torts operate.
The objective of the course is to provide you with a:
Good understanding and appreciation of the operating and financial risks that firms face
Strong conceptual and technical knowledge in the measurement, reporting, and analysis of these risks.
To provide focus to this course, emphasis is placed on two major areas:
a) Firms’ investment strategy as part of their Risk Management policy, and the resultant consolidated financial statements
b) Firms’ use of derivative financial
instruments as part of their Risk Management policy, and the impact of these hedging activities on the firms’ financial position and performances.
You are expected to have a strong foundation in the basic Financial Accounting issues and the associated technical competence before reading this course.
The course focuses on identifying and understanding the sources of superior firm performance through a process of analyses and syntheses. This entails an understanding of theoretical concepts and frameworks.
You will learn to analyse the external and internal environments of the firm, and formulate and execute different types of strategies with the considerations of ethics and the interests of various stakeholders.
Strategic issues are examined from the perspective of a chief executive or general manager who needs to formulate effective strategies and develop the necessary resources and capabilities to achieve sustainable competitive advantage in a highly volatile, competitive global environment.
This course is designed to provide you with a working knowledge of the concepts, principles, and applications of taxation laws and practices in Singapore, most notably those relating to the Income Tax and the Goods and Services Tax.
The emphasis of the course will be on the:
Identification of tax issues faced by businesses and individuals in structuring their economic transactions
Analysis of the impact that taxes may have on the decision-making processes of businesses and individual
Formulation of strategies to mitigate and control such costs through legitimate tax planning
Many organizations are data rich and information poor. The large volumes of data in an organization are “oilfields” rich in information content that are pending extraction with the right tools and models. Analytics involves the art of data
exploration, visualization, communication, and the science of analyzing large quantities of data to discover meaningful patterns and useful insights to support decision-making. The primary objective of this course is to introduce students to various
techniques available to extract useful insights from the large volumes of data. At the end of the course, students will not only see the substantial opportunities that exist in real world, but also learn techniques that allow them to exploit these
opportunities.
Analytics, Data Science and Artificial Intelligence are transforming business, social and government’s decision making. This course will show how important ideas and concepts were applied in real world applications to make better Data driven decisions.
